intro: Phyllonoma cacuminis, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-shaped, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that resemble stars. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Phyllonoma cacuminis prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
